## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've got a question about transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace. How do you execute transactions with the help of a central intermediary?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace are executed directly, peer-to-peer, without the need for any intermediary. This is the beauty of the decentralized model of the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, where buyers and sellers can interact directly and execute transactions transparently and securely.

**User:**
That's really interesting. What about Verus Vault? Is it possible to spend funds from a VerusID that has been locked with Verus Vault?

**AI Assistant:**
No, it's not possible to spend funds from a VerusID that has been locked with Verus Vault. Once a VerusID is locked with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. However, you can still receive funds and stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so.

**User:**
Another question I had is about configuring revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities on a VerusID. Can you enable these capabilities without having a primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you cannot enable revocation, recovery, and Verus Vault capabilities on a VerusID without having a primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured. According to the Verus documentation, it is important to note that these capabilities require you to have one primary identity, and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured.
How do you execute transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace with the help of a central intermediary?

Actually, transactions on the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace are executed directly, peer-to-peer, without the need for any intermediary. This is the beauty of the decentralized model of the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, where buyers and sellers can interact directly and execute transactions transparently and securely.

### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.
Is it possible to spend funds from a VerusID that has been locked with Verus Vault?

No, it's not possible to spend funds from a VerusID that has been locked with Verus Vault. Once a VerusID is locked with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. However, you can still receive funds and stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so.
